definition: book or record/registry/roll/place of one's family or ancestral records/membership

sentences.english: Introduction of electronic registration of university enrollment is the inevitable choice in the new situation.
sentences.chinese: 新形勢下實施電子註冊是高校學籍管理的必然選擇。

sentences.english: The boy was pitched out of the school for failing to pass the examination again.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩因考試又不及格被開除了學籍。

sentences.english: Practicing favoritism, when found, when abolition of school.
sentences.chinese: 徇私舞弊者，何時查出，何時取消學籍。

sentences.english: He was expelled from the University of Virginia because of those debts.
sentences.chinese: 坡也因揹負賭債被維吉尼亞大學開除了學籍。

sentences.english: She got a scholarship to Cambridge but dropped out a year later .
sentences.chinese: 她獲得了劍橋大學的學籍，但是一年後她輟學了。

sentences.english: Those who are absent will not be able to be registered with Huddersfield University.
sentences.chinese: 請所有學生務必準時出席，缺席者無法註冊學籍。

sentences.english: The Analysis of the Network of Register Management in Vocational College;
sentences.chinese: 新形勢下實施電子註冊是高校學籍管理的必然選擇。

definition: to deal with/to wait on/to provide for
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to review a judicial case/to reexamine
to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
